MOD.description: Watchdog mode register. This register determines the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

WDEN.description: Watchdog enable bit. This bit is Set Only.

WDRESET.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. This bit is Set Only. See Table 652.

NORESET.description: A watchdog timeout will not cause a chip reset.

RESET.description: A watchdog timeout will cause a chip reset.

WDTOF.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, cleared by software.

WDINT.description: Watchdog interrupt flag.  Cleared by software.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TC.description: Watchdog timer constant register. The value in this register determines the time-out value.

FEED.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

Feed.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

TV.description: Watchdog timer value register. This register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

LOCK.description: If this bit is set to one writing to this register does not affect bit 0. The clock source can only be changed by first clearing this bit, then writing the new value of bit 0.

UNLOCKED.description: This bit is set to 0 on any reset. It cannot be cleared by software.

LOCKED.description:
Software can set this bit to 1 at any time. Once WDLOCK is set, the bits of this register
										cannot be modified.

IR.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

CR0INT.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

CR1INT.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TCR.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

CEN.description: When one, the Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting. When zero, the counters are disabled.

CRST.description: When one, the Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TC.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

PR.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (PC) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

PC.description: Prescale Counter. The 32 bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

MCR.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT.description: Interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_.description: TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT.description: Interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_.description: TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT.description: Interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_.description: TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC

INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT.description: Interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_.description: TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CCR.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

ENABLE.description: A sequence of 0 then 1 on CAPn.0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.
A sequence of 1 then 0 on CAPn.0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.
A CR0 load due to a CAPn.0 event will generate an interrupt.
A sequence of 0 then 1 on CAPn.1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.
A sequence of 1 then 0 on CAPn.1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.
A CR1 load due to a CAPn.1 event will generate an interrupt.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

EMR.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the external match pins.

EM0.description: External Match 0. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 5:4 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

EM1.description: External Match 1. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 7:6 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.1 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

EM2.description: External Match 2. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 9:8 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

EM3.description: External Match 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 11:10 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

EMC0.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

EMC1.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

EMC2.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

EMC3.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CTCR.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

CTMODE.description: Counter/Timer Mode This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale Register.

TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

RISING.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

FALLING.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

DUALEDGE.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

CINSEL.description: Count Input Select When bits 1:0 in this register are not 00, these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected for a particular CAPn input in the TnCTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (TnCCR) must be programmed as 000. However, capture and/or interrupt can be selected for the other 3 CAPn inputs in the same timer.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

RBR.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read (DLAB =0).
The UARTn Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UARTn Rx FIFO.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

THR.description: Transmit Holding Regiter. The next character to be transmitted is written here (DLAB =0).
Writing to the UARTn Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UARTn transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

DLL.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider (DLAB =1).

DLLSB.description: The UARTn Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the UnDLM register, determines the baud rate of the UARTn.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

DLM.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider (DLAB =1).

DLMSB.description: The UARTn Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the U0DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UARTn.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

IER.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART interrupts (DLAB =0).

RBRIE.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UARTn. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

THREIE.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UARTn. The status of this can be read from UnLSR[5].

RXIE.description: RX Line Status Interrupt Enable. Enables the UARTn RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from UnLSR[4:1].

DISABLE_THE_RX_LINE_.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

ENABLE_THE_RX_LINE_S.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

ABEOINTEN.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

IIR.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

INTSTATUS.description: Interrupt status. Note that UnIIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating UnIIR[3:1].

AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

INTID.description: Interrupt identification. UnIER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UARTn Rx or TX FIFO. All other combinations of UnIER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (000,100,101,111).

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

ABEOINT.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

ABTOINT.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

FCR.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART FIFO usage and modes.

UARTN_FIFOS_ARE_DISA.description: UARTn FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

ACTIVE_HIGH_ENABLE_F.description: Active high enable for both UARTn Rx and TX FIFOs and UnFCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the related UART FIFOs.

NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_.description: No impact on either of UARTn FIFOs.

WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO.description: Writing a logic 1 to UnFCR[1] will clear all bytes in UARTn Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_.description: No impact on either of UARTn FIFOs.

WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO.description: Writing a logic 1 to UnFCR[2] will clear all bytes in UARTn TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

DMAMODE.description: DMA Mode Select. When the FIFO enable (bit 0 of this register) is set, this bit selects the DMA mode. See Section 18.6.6.1.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

RXTRIGLVL.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UARTn FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt or DMA request is activated.

LCR.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UARTn TXD is forced to logic 0 when UnLCR[6] is active high.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

LSR.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

RDR.description: Receiver Data Ready. UnLSR[0] is set when the UnRBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UARTn RBR FIFO is empty.

EMPTY.description: The UARTn receiver FIFO is empty.

NOTEMPTY.description: The UARTn receiver FIFO is not empty.

OE.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[1]. UnLSR[1] is set when UARTn RSR has a new character assembled and the UARTn RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UARTn RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UARTn RSR will be lost.

PE.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

FE.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Upon detection of a framing error, the Rx will attempt to resynchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BI.description: Break Interrupt. When RXDn is held in the spacing state (all zeroes) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXDn goes to marking state (all ones). An UnLSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

THRE.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty.  THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UARTn THR and is cleared on a UnTHR write.

TEMT.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both UnTHR and UnTSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the UnTSR or the UnTHR contain valid data.

VALIDDATA.description: UnTHR and/or the UnTSR contains valid data.

EMPTY.description: UnTHR and the UnTSR are empty.

RXFE.description: Error in RX FIFO . UnLSR[7] is set when a character with a Rx error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the UnRBR. This bit is cleared when the UnLSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UARTn FIFO.

NOERROR.description: UnRBR contains no UARTn RX errors or UnFCR[0]=0.

ERRORS.description: UARTn RBR contains at least one UARTn RX error.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

SCR.description: Scratch Pad Register. 8-bit temporary storage for software.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

ACR.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

START.description: Start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UARTn Rx falling edge)

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

ABEOINTCLR.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

ABTOINTCLR.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

FDR.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

DIVADDVAL.description: Baud-rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud-rate generator will not impact the UARTn baudrate.

MULVAL.description: Baud-rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UARTn to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud-rate generator is used or not.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TER.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TXEN.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit is cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software implementing software-handshaking can clear this bit when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

RS485CTRL.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

DISABLED.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

ENABLED.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte has the parity bit = 1, generating a received data interrupt. See Section 18.6.16 RS-485/EIA-485 modes of operation.

DISABLED.description: The receiver is disabled.
Auto Address Detect (AAD) is disabled.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

OINV.description: Direction control pin polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the Un_OE pin.

DIRLOW.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

DIRHIGH.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

RS485ADRMATCH.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

DLY.description: Contains the direction control (UnOE) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

RBR.description: DLAB =0 Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read.
The UART1 Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UART1 RX FIFO.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

THR.description: DLAB =0. Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here.
Writing to the UART1 Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UART1 transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

DLL.description: DLAB =1. Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider.

DLLSB.description: The UART1 Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the U1DLM register, determines the baud rate of the UART1.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

DLM.description: DLAB =1. Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider.

DLMSB.description: The UART1 Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the U1DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UART1.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

IER.description: DLAB =0. Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART1 interrupts.

RBRIE.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UART1. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

THREIE.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UART1. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[5].

RXIE.description: RX Line Interrupt Enable. Enables the UART1 RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[4:1].

DISABLE_THE_RX_LINE_.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

ENABLE_THE_RX_LINE_S.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

MSIE.description: Modem Status Interrupt Enable. Enables the modem interrupt. The status of this interrupt can be read from MSR[3:0].

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CTSIE.description: CTS Interrupt Enable. If auto-cts mode is enabled this bit enables/disables the modem status interrupt generation on a CTS1 signal transition. If auto-cts mode is disabled a CTS1 transition will generate an interrupt if Modem Status Interrupt Enable (IER[3]) is set. In normal operation a CTS1 signal transition will generate a Modem Status Interrupt unless the interrupt has been disabled by clearing the IER[3] bit in the IER register. In auto-cts mode a transition on the CTS1 bit will trigger an interrupt only if both the IER[3] and IER[7] bits are set.

ABEOIE.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

IIR.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

INTSTATUS.description: Interrupt status. Note that IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating IIR[3:1].

AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

INTID.description: Interrupt identification. IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UART1 Rx or TX FIFO. All other combinations of IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (100,101,111).

RESERVED.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

ABEOINT.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

ABTOINT.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

FCR.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART1 FIFO usage and modes.

MUST_NOT_BE_USED_IN_.description: Must not be used in the application.

ACTIVE_HIGH_ENABLE_F.description: Active high enable for both UART1 Rx and TX FIFOs and FCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART1 operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the UART1 FIFOs.

NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_.description: No impact on either of UART1 FIFOs.

WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[1] will clear all bytes in UART1 Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_.description: No impact on either of UART1 FIFOs.

WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[2] will clear all bytes in UART1 TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

DMAMODE.description: DMA Mode Select. When the FIFO enable bit (bit 0 of this register) is set, this bit selects the DMA mode. See Section 36.6.6.1.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits.

RXTRIGLVL.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UART1 FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt is activated.

LCR.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UART1 TXD is forced to logic 0 when LCR[6] is active high.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

MCR.description: Modem Control Register. Contains controls for flow control handshaking and loopback mode.

DTRCTRL.description: DTR Control.  Source for modem output pin, DTR. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

RTSCTRL.description: RTS Control.  Source for modem output pin RTS. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

LMS.description: Loopback Mode Select.  The modem loopback mode provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing. Serial data from the transmitter is connected internally to serial input of the receiver. Input pin, RXD1, has no effect on loopback and output pin, TXD1 is held in marking state. The 4 modem inputs (CTS, DSR, RI and DCD) are disconnected externally. Externally, the modem outputs (RTS, DTR) are set inactive. Internally, the 4 modem outputs are connected to the 4 modem inputs. As a result of these connections, the upper 4 bits of the MSR will be driven by the lower 4 bits of the MCR rather than the 4 modem inputs in normal mode. This permits modem status interrupts to be generated in loopback mode by writing the lower 4 bits of MCR.

LSR.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

RDR.description: Receiver Data Ready.  LSR[0] is set when the RBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UART1 RBR FIFO is empty.

EMPTY.description: The UART1 receiver FIFO is empty.

NOTEMPTY.description: The UART1 receiver FIFO is not empty.

OE.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. An LSR read clears LSR[1]. LSR[1] is set when UART1 RSR has a new character assembled and the UART1 RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UART1 RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UART1 RSR will be lost.

PE.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. An LSR read clears LSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UART1 RBR FIFO.

FE.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. An LSR read clears LSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on FCR0. Upon detection of a framing error, the RX will attempt to resynchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UART1 RBR FIFO.

BI.description: Break Interrupt.  When RXD1 is held in the spacing state (all zeroes) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXD1 goes to marking state (all ones). An LSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UART1 RBR FIFO.

THRE.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty.  THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UART1 THR and is cleared on a THR write.

TEMT.description: Transmitter Empty.  TEMT is set when both THR and TSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the TSR or the THR contain valid data.

VALID.description: THR and/or the TSR contains valid data.

EMPTY.description: THR and the TSR are empty.

RXFE.description: Error in RX FIFO. LSR[7] is set when a character with a RX error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the RBR. This bit is cleared when the LSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UART1 FIFO.

NOERROR.description: RBR contains no UART1 RX errors or FCR[0]=0.

ERRORS.description: UART1 RBR contains at least one UART1 RX error.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

MSR.description: Modem Status Register. Contains handshake signal status flags.

DCTS.description: Delta CTS. Set upon state change of input CTS. Cleared on an MSR read.

NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O.description: No change detected on modem input, CTS.

STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE.description: State change detected on modem input, CTS.

DDSR.description: Delta DSR. Set upon state change of input DSR. Cleared on an MSR read.

NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O.description: No change detected on modem input, DSR.

STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE.description: State change detected on modem input, DSR.

TERI.description: Trailing Edge RI. Set upon low to high transition of input RI. Cleared on an MSR read.

NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O.description: No change detected on modem input, RI.

DDCD.description: Delta DCD. Set upon state change of input DCD. Cleared on an MSR read.

NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O.description: No change detected on modem input, DCD.

STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE.description: State change detected on modem input, DCD.

CTS.description: Clear To Send State. Complement of input signal CTS. This bit is connected to MCR[1] in modem loopback mode.

DSR.description: Data Set Ready State. Complement of input signal DSR. This bit is connected to MCR[0] in modem loopback mode.

RI.description: Ring Indicator State. Complement of input RI. This bit is connected to MCR[2] in modem loopback mode.

DCD.description: Data Carrier Detect State. Complement of input DCD. This bit is connected to MCR[3] in modem loopback mode.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

SCR.description: Scratch Pad Register. 8-bit temporary storage for software.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

ACR.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

START.description: Auto-baud start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.
Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UART1 Rx falling edge)

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

ABEOINTCLR.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only).

WRITING_A_1_WILL_CLE.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.
Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

FDR.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

DIVADDVAL.description: Baud rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the UART1 baud rate.

MULVAL.description: Baud rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UART1 to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TER.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

TXEN.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software can clear this bit when it detects that the a hardware-handshaking TX-permit signal (CTS) has gone false, or with software handshaking, when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it detects that the TX-permit signal has gone true, or when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

RS485CTRL.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

NMMEN.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) mode select.

ENABLED_IN_THIS_MOD.description: Enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the UART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt.

RTS_IF_DIRECTION_CO.description: RTS. If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin RTS is used for direction control.

DTR_IF_DIRECTION_CO.description: DTR. If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin DTR is used for direction control.

OINV.description: Polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the RTS (or DTR) pin.

LOW_THE_DIRECTION_C.description: LOW. The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

HIGH_THE_DIRECTION_.description: HIGH. The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

RS485ADRMATCH.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

DLY.description: Contains the direction control (RTS or DTR) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

IR.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts, or read to identify which PWM interrupt sources are pending.

PWMMR0INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 0.

PWMMR1INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 1.

PWMMR2INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 2.

PWMMR3INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 3.

PWMCAP1INT.description: Interrupt flag for capture input 1 (available in PWM1IR only; this bit is reserved in PWM0IR).

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

PWMMR4INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 4.

PWMMR5INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 5.

PWMMR6INT.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 6.

TCR.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions.

THE_PWM_TIMER_COUNTE.description: The PWM Timer Counter and PWM Prescale Counter are enabled for counting.
The PWM Timer Counter and the PWM Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until this bit is returned to zero.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_.description: PWM mode is enabled (counter resets to 1). PWM mode causes the shadow registers to operate in connection with the Match registers. A program write to a Match register will not have an effect on the Match result until the corresponding bit in PWMLER has been set, followed by the occurrence of a PWM Match 0 event. Note that the PWM Match register that determines the PWM rate (PWM Match Register 0 - MR0) must be set up prior to the PWM being enabled. Otherwise a Match event will not occur to cause shadow register contents to become effective.

TIMER_MODE_IS_ENABLE.description: Timer mode is enabled (counter resets to 0).

MDIS.description: Master Disable (PWM0 only). The two PWMs may be synchronized using the Master Disable control bit. The Master disable bit of the Master PWM (PWM0 module) controls a secondary enable input to both PWMs, as shown in Figure 141.  This bit has no function in the Slave PWM (PWM1).

MASTER_USE_PWM0_IS_.description: Master use. PWM0 is the master, and both PWMs are enabled for counting.

INDIVIDUAL_USE_THE_.description: Individual use. The PWMs are used independently, and the individual Counter Enable bits are used to control the PWMs.

TC.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

PR.description: Prescale Register. Determines how often the PWM counter is incremented.

PC.description: Prescale Counter. Prescaler for the main PWM counter.

MCR.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control whether an interrupt is generated and if the PWM counter is reset when a Match occurs.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR0.description: Interrupt on PWMMR0: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR0 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR0_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR0: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR0 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR0_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR0: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR0 matches the PWMTC.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR1.description: Interrupt on PWMMR1: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR1 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR1_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR1: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR1 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR1_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR1: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR1 matches the PWMTC.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR2.description: Interrupt on PWMMR2: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR2 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR2_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR2: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR2 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR2_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR2: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR0 matches the PWMTC.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR3.description: Interrupt on PWMMR3: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR3 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR3_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR3: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR3 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR3_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR3: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR0 matches the PWMTC.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR4.description: Interrupt on PWMMR4: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR4 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR4_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR4: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR4 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR4_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR4: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR4 matches the PWMTC.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR5.description: Interrupt on PWMMR5: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR5 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR5_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR5: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR5 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR5_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR5: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR5 matches the PWMTC.

INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR6.description: Interrupt on PWMMR6: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR6 matches the value in the PWMTC.

RESET_ON_PWMMR6_THE.description: Reset on PWMMR6: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR6 matches it.

DISABLED.description: Disabled

STOP_ON_PWMMR6_THE_.description: Stop on PWMMR6: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR6 matches the PWMTC.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

CCR.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated for a capture event.

RISING_EDGE_A_SYNCH.description: Rising edge. A synchronously sampled rising edge on PWMn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of the TC.

FALLING_EDGE_A_SYNC.description: Falling edge. A synchronously sampled falling edge on PWMn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

INTERRUPT_A_CR0_LOA.description: Interrupt. A CR0 load due to a PWMn_CAP0 event will generate an interrupt.

CAP1_R.description: Capture on PWMn_CAP1 rising edge. Reserved for PWM0.

RISING_EDGE_A_SYNCH.description: Rising edge. A synchronously sampled rising edge on PWMn_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of the TC.

CAP1_F.description: Capture on PWMn_CAP1 falling edge. Reserved for PWM0.

FALLING_EDGE_A_SYNC.description: Falling edge. A synchronously sampled falling edge on PWMn_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

CAP1_I.description: Interrupt on PWMn_CAP1 event. Reserved for PWM0.

INTERRUPT_A_CR1_LOA.description: Interrupt. A CR1 load due to a PWMn_CAP1 event will generate an interrupt.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

PCR.description: PWM Control Register. Enables PWM outputs and selects either single edge or double edge controlled PWM outputs.

RESERVED.description: Unused, always zero.

PWMSEL2.description: PWM[2] output single/double edge mode control.

SINGLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Single edge controlled mode is selected.

DOUBLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Double edge controlled mode is selected.

SINGLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Single edge controlled mode is selected.

DOUBLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Double edge controlled mode is selected.

SINGLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Single edge controlled mode is selected.

DOUBLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Double edge controlled mode is selected.

SINGLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Single edge controlled mode is selected.

DOUBLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Double edge controlled mode is selected.

SINGLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Single edge controlled mode is selected.

DOUBLE_EDGE_CONTROLL.description: Double edge controlled mode is selected.

PWMENA6.description: PWM[6] output enable control. See PWMENA1 for details.

LER.description: Load Enable Register. Enables use of updated PWM match values.

MAT0LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 0 Latch. PWM MR0 register update control. Writing a one to this bit allows the last value written to the PWM Match Register 0 to be become effective when the timer is next reset by a PWM Match event. See Section 27.6.7.

MAT1LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 1 Latch. PWM MR1 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

MAT2LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 2 Latch. PWM MR2 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

MAT3LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 3 Latch. PWM MR3 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

MAT4LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 4 Latch. PWM MR4 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

MAT5LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 5 Latch. PWM MR5 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

MAT6LATCHEN.description: Enable PWM Match 6 Latch. PWM MR6 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

CTCR.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

TIMER_MODE_THE_TC_I.description: Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale register.

RISING_EDGE_COUNTER_.description: Rising edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on rising edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

FALLING_EDGE_COUNTER.description: Falling edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on falling edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

DUAL_EDGE_COUNTER_MO.description: Dual edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on both edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

CIS.description: Count Input Select. When bits 1:0 are not 00, these bits select which PWM_CAP pin carries the signal used to increment the TC. Other combinations are reserved.

FOR_PWM0_00_EQ_PWM0_.description: For PWM0: 00 = PWM0_CAP0 (Other combinations are reserved) For PWM1: 00 = PWM1_CAP0, 01 = PWM1_CAP1 (Other combinations are reserved)

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

CONSET.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

STAT.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Status.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

DAT.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

Data.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

ADR0.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

Address.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

SCLH.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.
Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

SCLL.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. SCLL and SCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.
Count for SCL low time period selection.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CONCLR.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

THE_I_2C_MODULE_WILL.description: The I 2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above.   That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

DATA_BUFFER.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

Data.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CR.description: SPI Control Register. This register controls the operation of the SPI.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BITENABLE.description: The SPI controller sends and receives 8 bits of data per transfer.

THE_SPI_CONTROLLER_S.description: The SPI controller sends and receives the number of bits selected by bits 11:8.

CPHA.description: Clock phase control determines the relationship between the data and the clock on SPI transfers, and controls when a slave transfer is defined as starting and ending.

FIRST_EDGE.description: Data is sampled on the first clock edge of SCK. A transfer starts and ends with activation and deactivation of the SSEL signal.

SECOND_EDGE.description: Data is sampled on the second clock edge of the SCK. A transfer starts with the first clock edge, and ends with the last sampling edge when the SSEL signal is active.

SLAVE.description: The SPI operates in Slave mode.

MASTER.description: The SPI operates in Master mode.

LSBF.description: LSB First controls which direction each byte is shifted when transferred.

MSB.description: SPI data is transferred MSB (bit 7) first.

LSB.description: SPI data is transferred LSB (bit 0) first.

HWINT.description: A hardware interrupt is generated each time the SPIF or MODF bits are activated.

BITS.description: When bit 2 of this register is 1, this field controls the number of bits per transfer:

SR.description: SPI Status Register. This register shows the status of the SPI.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

ABRT.description: Slave abort. When 1, this bit indicates that a slave abort has occurred. This bit is cleared by reading this register.

MODF.description: Mode fault. when 1, this bit indicates that a Mode fault error has occurred. This bit is cleared by reading this register, then writing the SPI0 control register.

ROVR.description: Read overrun. When 1, this bit indicates that a read overrun has occurred. This bit is cleared by reading this register.

WCOL.description: Write collision. When 1, this bit indicates that a write collision has occurred. This bit is cleared by reading this register, then accessing the SPI Data Register.

SPIF.description: SPI transfer complete flag. When 1, this bit indicates when a SPI data transfer is complete. When a master, this bit is set at the end of the last cycle of the transfer. When a slave, this bit is set on the last data sampling edge of the SCK. This bit is cleared by first reading this register, then accessing the SPI Data Register. Note: this is not the SPI interrupt flag. This flag is found in the SPINT register.

DR.description: SPI Data Register. This bi-directional register provides the transmit and receive data for the SPI. Transmit data is provided to the SPI0 by writing to this register. Data received by the SPI0 can be read from this register.

DATAHIGH.description: If bit 2 of the SPCR is 1 and bits 11:8 are other than 1000, some or all of these bits contain the additional transmit and receive bits. When less than 16 bits are selected, the more significant among these bits read as zeroes.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CCR.description: SPI Clock Counter Register. This register controls the frequency of a master's SCK0.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

INT.description: SPI Interrupt Flag. This register contains the interrupt flag for the SPI interface.

SPIF.description: SPI interrupt flag. Set by the SPI interface to generate an interrupt. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Note: this bit will be set once when SPIE = 1 and at least one of SPIF and WCOL bits is 1. However, only when the SPI Interrupt bit is set and SPI0 Interrupt is enabled in the NVIC, SPI based interrupt can be processed by interrupt handling software.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

RTCCIF.description: When one, the Counter Increment Interrupt block generated an interrupt. Writing a one to this bit location clears the counter increment interrupt.

RTCALF.description: When one, the alarm registers generated an interrupt. Writing a one to this bit location clears the alarm interrupt.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

THE_TIME_COUNTERS_AR.description: The time counters are disabled so that they may be initialized.

RESET.description: When one, the elements in the internal oscillator divider are reset, and remain reset until CCR[1] is changed to zero. This is the divider that generates the 1 Hz clock from the 32.768 kHz crystal. The state of the divider is not visible to software.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

THE_CALIBRATION_COUN.description: The calibration counter is enabled and counting, using the 1 Hz clock. When the calibration counter is equal to the value of the CALIBRATION register, the counter resets and repeats counting up to the value of the CALIBRATION register. See Section 30.6.4.2 and  Section 30.6.5.

IMSEC.description: When 1, an increment of the Second value generates an interrupt.

IMMIN.description: When 1, an increment of the Minute value generates an interrupt.

IMHOUR.description: When 1, an increment of the Hour value generates an interrupt.

IMDOM.description: When 1, an increment of the Day of Month value generates an interrupt.

IMDOW.description: When 1, an increment of the Day of Week value generates an interrupt.

IMDOY.description: When 1, an increment of the Day of Year value generates an interrupt.

IMMON.description: When 1, an increment of the Month value generates an interrupt.

IMYEAR.description: When 1, an increment of the Year value generates an interrupt.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

AMRSEC.description: When 1, the Second value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRMIN.description: When 1, the Minutes value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRHOUR.description: When 1, the Hour value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRDOM.description: When 1, the Day of Month value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRDOW.description: When 1, the Day of Week value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRDOY.description: When 1, the Day of Year value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRMON.description: When 1, the Month value is not compared for the alarm.

AMRYEAR.description: When 1, the Year value is not compared for the alarm.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

SECONDS.description: Seconds value in the range of 0 to 59

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

MINUTES.description: Minutes value in the range of 0 to 59

HOURS.description: Hours value in the range of 0 to 23

DOW.description: Day of week value in the range of 0 to 6

DOM.description: Day of month value in the range of 1 to 28, 29, 30, or 31 (depending on the month and whether it is a leap year).

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

MONTH.description: Month value in the range of 1 to 12.

YEAR.description: Year value in the range of 0 to 4095.

DOY.description: Day of year value in the range of 1 to 365 (366 for leap years).

RESERVED.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

SECONDS.description: Seconds value in the range of 0 to 59

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

MINUTES.description: Minutes value in the range of 0 to 59

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

HOURS.description: Hours value in the range of 0 to 23

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

DOM.description: Day of month value in the range of 1 to 28, 29, 30, or 31 (depending on the month and whether it is a leap year).

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

DOW.description: Day of week value in the range of 0 to 6.

DOY.description: Day of year value in the range of 1 to 365 (366 for leap years).

MONTH.description: Month value in the range of 1 to 12.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

YEAR.description: Year value in the range of 0 to 4095.

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

CALVAL.description: If enabled, the calibration counter counts up to this value. The maximum value is 131, 072 corresponding to about 36.4 hours. Calibration is disabled if CALVAL = 0.

BACKWARD_CALIBRATION.description: Backward calibration. When CALVAL is equal to the calibration counter, the RTC timers will stop incrementing for 1 second.

FORWARD_CALIBRATION_.description: Forward calibration. When CALVAL is equal to the calibration counter, the RTC timers will jump by 2 seconds.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

RTC_OSCF.description: RTC Oscillator Fail detect flag. Read: this bit is set if the RTC oscillator stops, and when RTC power is first turned on. An interrupt will occur when this bit is set, the RTC_OSCFEN bit in RTC_AUXEN is a 1, and the RTC interrupt is enabled in the NVIC. Write: writing a 1 to this bit clears the flag.

RTC_PDOUT.description: When 0: the RTC_ALARM pin reflects the RTC alarm status. When 1: the RTC_ALARM pin indicates Deep Power-down mode.

RESERVED.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

RTC_OSCFEN.description: Oscillator Fail Detect interrupt enable. When 0: the RTC Oscillator Fail detect interrupt is disabled. When 1: the RTC Oscillator Fail detect interrupt is enabled. See Section 30.6.2.5.

SECONDS.description: Seconds value in the range of 0 to 59

RESERVED.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

MINUTES.description: Minutes value in the range of 0 to 59
